p: Climate change, given a particular time and place, could trigger extreme weather or damaging events. For instance, floods, cryogenic disasters, and droughts are potential damaging weather events that could occur [ 8]. Due to global warming being accelerated by human activities, extreme climate events such as heat waves and torrential rains are becoming increasingly frequent [ 1, 8]. Research studies predicted that if the global average temperature grows 2 Â°C above its level before the industrial age, human-induced climate change could trigger more than 40% torrential rain and 96% extreme high-temperatures [ 1].
